review_text: I love this place for what it is. I took my parents here when they came to visit and just really enjoyed the food and atmosphere. We got the prix fixe menu, which gave us the opportunity to try everything and it really didn't disappoint. We are Egyptian, so getting a good Mediterranean meal somewhere that isn't home is always a treat. The hummus and other dips were really good, particularly the spicy pepper muhammara. Then the smoked lamb tacos were absolutely awesome, and I would go back only for these once a week if I could. We then got a big sampler of all of the meats, and it was amazing. The chicken was super tender, the adana was perfectly seasoned and cooked and the lamb chops were the best I've had in a while. The only knock is that the lamb riblets were really fatty, but that's not atypical. Dessert was more than solid and the three of us left really satisfied. I'm definitely coming back.

review_text:
The menu is quite faithfully Turkish, with a few nods to the rest of the middle east. The ambiance is nice, upscale-y (albeit quite corporate because of the location). The service is attentive and polite.

The food:
I think the best part of the food is the fresh hot bread that comes out right after you've been seated. Get a few dips with it to make it even better - the smoked eggplant, and the spicy feta and red pepper are my favorite. But be careful with the bread....don't fill up, because you want to leave space for the actual food. And the food is definitely worth the effort of restraint with the bread.

The other mezzes are good too - here again, my favorites are the artichokes and the crispy phyllo rolls.

The grape leaf wrapped branzino is perfectly cooked. But you can't go wrong with the chicken shashlik either.

This place wins in the department of consistency too - the meal is spot on every time.

Great spot for work lunch. Lively dining room but not too loud. Attentive service. Tasty food. 

We settled on Pera Mediterranean Brasserie for a weekday lunch and had window seating by the bar which made for good people-watching both inside the restaurant and on Madison. Small plates and mezzes are great for sharing. We split the grilled octopus, dolmas, and the platter of dips which were pretty tasty. 

I had the steak burger with kasseri cheese as my entree. It's a hefty burger that's very satisfying. The burger is meaty and juicy with the slightly trangy goats milk cheese a nice counterpoint to all that unctuous meat. I opted for the side salad over fries which was a good choice. It added some brightness to the meal. 

All in a great spot midtown for a working lunch. Service was attentive and Pera has a good energy about the place that isn't overwhelming.

review_text: Finding a dining spot for a birthday proved to be both stressful and tricky for a party of 12. I frantically searched for a restaurant that could accommodate that size while following all COVID guidelines during these trying times. I came across Pera while making reservations on Open Table. Upon seeing this the server returned later and specifically ask me if this is what I wanted to do. Although I did not leave the double tip, I gave them an extra one for the courtesy. This was a great dinner spot for such a strange dining environment we are currently in. I hope to be able to return soon!

I booked outdoor seating for a business lunch and had called the restaurant in advance to confirm that the outdoor dining setup was something my group would be comfortable with - there are several of us that are more cautious about covid than others (for various health reasons), looking for open-air dining, not an enclosed tent. When I called, I was told that the outdoor setup was open on one side for air flow. When we arrived, this was not the case - it was fully enclosed with plastic on all sides, except for a small doorway. After we ordered, I asked the waitress if they could roll up the plastic on one side to let air flow in (there were ties hanging down so it was clear that this was a possibility) - she said she would ask the manager and then just didn't come back until we were done with our meal. Having said that, my colleagues did enjoy the food very much, in spite of some being very uncomfortable. I just wish the staff had been more transparent about the setup and more responsive when we asked for them to make the adjustment. It was a 70 degree day today - there was no reason they couldn't have opened it up. 

If not for the lack of transparency and the ignored request around the outdoor dining setup, I would have given a much higher rating.

Came for Restaurant Week and blown away by how good the food was. We weren't super hungry and ended up ordering two restaurant week specials for the four of us along with an order of fries. We got the trio of dips, spicy calamari, lamb adana kebab, and chicken shashlik. Though the chicken wasn't my first choice, it ended up being my favorite dish of the meal. Perfectly charred on the outside and juicy on the inside, it's quite possibly the best shashlik I've had anywhere. The pilaf it came with was also delicious, with lovely nutty notes. I also did the wine pairing and was pleased with both pours - white for the apps and red for entrees, though you can customize and pick which wines you want if you prefer.

Service was good and the outdoor patio had good shade coverage and a nice breeze on a sweltering day.  I was pleased with the wheelchair accessibility and could easily get to the table on the raised platform, into the restaurant, and to the accessible restroom.

review_text:
How often can I say that I had lunch and dinner at the same place? Not often, but Pera is that kind of place in which having two meals in one day is a plus not a drag. 

I had to entertain two groups today and chose Pera as my destination of choice. I had been there a couple of times with different groups and had always had nothing but good things to say about it. 

The first group was a take out order. I have to say that the whole take out experience was somewhat stressful and that is why I am giving it 4 stars. Although the website points you to Seamless, they haven't resumed delivery service through Seamless yet and there is no indication  on the website about it. Seamless just says that the restaurant is "closed."  I was not sure if it was closed at the time I was trying to place my order or permanently closed. I called the number on the website numerous time until 10:30 am and no one would pick up the phone. I finally found an email on their website and got a response a couple of minutes later. Lesson: email don't call. After stressing about it the whole morning, I was able to order my take out order by phone. Crisis averted!! I had asked my party to choose what they wanted to eat from the online menu and having to choose a different restaurant would entail going through the whole selection process again. 

The food was well-package in individual boxes and labeled. 

Everyone love it! 

The seared salmon  with risoto and red peppercorns was out of this world!!!! Strongly recommended!!!

At night I went with a large group to the restaurant and the experience was, as usual, very pleasant. 

Serviced was a little rushed--I had to ask if there were any specials, which there was (baby lamb chops). And I am very glad I asked. The lamb chops  were incredible. I got four meaty lamb chops and by the end I was wondering where the full rack was!! I wanted it all!!

The grilled octopus appetizer is always a great option. You can't go wrong with it. The octopus is stubbornly tender and smoky. The white beans that go with it are packed with flavor. We also had the Chef's mixed mezze, a must have!

Desert was also quite an experience. The dark chocolate soufflé with pistachio (?) ice cream is a must!!!!!!

I love this place! 

My framework:
Can I cook it at home? Probably yes bc the food is not extra complex, but it is so good I would want to to try to replicate it at home. 
Can I make it better? Nope. They have nailed it. 
Does it tingle the brain? Check. 
Does it make me happy? Check.

review_text:
We had made reservations for a table of 6 and this review is specifically for NYC Restaurant Week (2021).

We got outside seating on a Friday evening for 6:30 pm on a relatively warm day. We arrived on time and were seated right away. The place was empty inside at that time and outdoor seating was slightly busy with 2 other tables occupied.

We ordered a few cocktails and some beer on tap and it took longer for us to get our drinks to us, including repeat orders for beers, which our waitress forgot to put it.

We ordered from the $39 per person NYC Restaurant Week menu, which included Assorted Dips Platter, Portuguese Calamari, Hand Rolled Grape Leaves, and a Maroul Salad. The Grape Leaves and Maroul Salad were absolutely delicious and were the best appetizers on the table.

For mains, we got Lamb Adana, Organic Beef Burger, and Black Pepper Ricotta Gnocchi. We all cleaned out our plates, and I can confirm that the Gnocchi was absolutely filing and delicious!

Our waitress was not attentive at all, but service other than that was absolutely top notch... so giving a 20% gratuity at end did suck a little bit! We might visit again for lunch or dinner!

Okay, full disclosure: I know the manager there, we went to high school together, and he invited me out to catch up. However, I'm not the type to let personal biases influence my opinion on things.

That said, it would only be fair to acknowledge that my experience was impacted by my being a friend of the guy in charge, so I can't really speak to the service, as I may or may not have been given preferential treatment.

With that in mind, I can speak to the food. The prices were reasonable relative to the area (it's located not too far from Grand Central and Times Square). The appetizers I was given, the phyllo rolls and the fried calamari, were really quite tasty. However, what I really have to praise is the Pera Organic Beef Burger. This might quite literally be the greatest burger I've ever had in my life, hands down. I'm not exaggerating. It was delicious enough to go thank the chef for the first time in my life.

review_text:
Came back here after a few years and have to say the food was just as excellent as I remember, if not better.   My husband (who is from Turkey) started a new job so we came here to celebrate and we couldn't have loved our food more.   Plus, we went to the Pera Palace Hotel for tea a couple of times when we were in Istanbul recently so we're pro-Pera!  To start, we had borek and a trio of dips to start and everything was delicious.   My cocktail, a smoked old fashioned, was phenomenal.  

For mains we had a fishcake and their take on steak frites.   Both were delicious.  The steak frites is thin sliced steak served kebab style (minus the skewer).   It was perfect.   For dessert, I had the lemon olive oil cake which was also great, especially with a scoop of ice cream.

I'd like to provide some constructive feedback to improve the experience overall.   The waiter asked if we wanted water and we ordered some sparkling water, which was brought promptly.   The next he came, he said "are you ready to order?".   That just seemed abrupt since he hadn't asked if we wanted anything other than water to drink or provided a drink menu.  I requested a drink menu as I knew they had some amazing specialty drinks so we waited for the menu and then ordered the drinks and our food.    This wouldn't be a big deal if I was at a diner and a lady with big hair and a note pad walked up to me and the first thing she said is "whadda ya want?" but when I'm dropping nearly $300 on dinner for two, can you at least offer me a drink?

The second thing that would help elevate the dining experience isn't a big deal but it's something that can differentiate a dining experience from a meal at Denny's.  When we'd finished our appetizers (the borek which had lots of sauce, plus the dips we had) our silverware was pretty dirty.  When they cleared our app plates, the guy put the dirty silver on the table and just took the plates.  

Are these little things causing an existential crisis for me? Absolutely not and I recognize they're first world problems but the point of the feedback is to help the restaurant live up to its promise.  You walk in and it looks very upscale and polished and then you have a couple of really simple service errors that creates some dissonance between the projected sophistication and the amateurish execution. 

I still give four stars because the food is amazing and I recognize that staffing in the service industry is tough but I think with a couple of tweaks, Pera can elevate its game.

Wanted to love it seeing that it is local to where i was However,  it wasn't as good as i thought and would recommend if your not in a rush and just want a leisurely meal. The service was  slow. Our server even stated that she needed our full order to be placed because the food takes time. We saw her maybe twice for the duration of the dinner. 

We ordered the grill octopus with fava beans, the village salad, both were well prepared and tasty. We also had the feta and watermelon salad which was sweet and refreshing. The calamari was lacked flavor but was crispy.

My table ordered the lamb chops special with potatoes and green beans, the steak frite and the gnocchi..all were tasty. Overall the the food is good however the service could of been better. I will be back for the lunch crowd.

review_text:
A local friend recommended Pera and while I didn't want to splurge anywhere "fancy" on my trip, I was convinced from the photos - and I am so glad I decided to try it.

The smoked eggplant with garlic yoghurt dip was sooo delicious, I wish I could buy tubs of it. What surprised us all though was how much we loved the chips that came with it too. Think Stacy's pita chips but homemade and fresh. When we ran out of dip, we still finished the chips on their own. We also ordered the grilled Spanish octopus and lamb "adana". Both were fantastic and cooked perfectly.

It has a lively and classy vibe to it and while we did not drink, we saw many great looking beverages leaving the bar. I would love to return to try more dishes and highly recommend this place for a nice night out!

review_text:
After seeing a Broadway show, my daughter & I walked into Pera for apps&drinks before taking the train back home. The bartender,who's name I didn't get,is tending bar, seating the walk-ins,the whole package. We sat at the bar & ordered lavender Mojitos,&that was absolute perfection.
Our apps...to die for..grilled artichoke beautifully plated, with green pea puree,like what? Sooooo good. Then the smoked eggplant with garlic yogurt served with pita chips, if I wasn't in a nice place I would've licked both plates.
Our 2nd drink was a mild jalapeño margarita,that our lovely bartender made & let us taste to wow us, AND IT WORKED.
I could've easily sat there with my kid for another hour, it was so cozy & pretty inside. 
A mediterranean gem, you won't be sorry
